page.title: 13 CHURCHES IN LEWES
page.content: Lewes has 6{Anglican}churches, a large number for a town this size. All have flourishing congregations and many Parish events. Peter Bell,Suffra- gan Bishop of Lewes,is responsible within the Diocese of Chichester. The{Roman Catholic Church}had no church in Lewes until the l870s. Its present church was built in the l930s. St.Pancras Roman Catholic Primary School serves the Lewes area. Lewes also has{Baptist}and{United {Reformed Churches. Methodists}and{Uni- {tarians}both worship in the Unitarian Chapel,and the{Quakers}meet at the beautiful Friends' Meeting House. A {Free Church}meets in Wallands School; {Jireh Chapel,}a small non-conformist sect, has a fine chapel, a listed building.{Lewes Council of Churches draws most denominations to a United Whit Sunday Service at the Castle.
